text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
(1) The following changes were made:

Reference Change Details Old IRM 4.19.12.10 Removed obsolete employee return procedures no longer done at the campus. Old IRM 4.19.12.11 Removed obsolete batching process no longer done at the campus. IRM 4.19.12.6 Editorial change to clarify text for procedures for amended returns. Old IRM 4.19.12.13 Removed obsolete hash totaling process no longer done at the campus. IRM 4.19.12.7 Editorial change to clarify text for selected case processing. IRM 4.19.12.8 Editorial changes to clarify text for accepted return processing. Old IRM 4.19.12.16 Removed obsolete master ap- pointment process no longer done at the campus. Old IRM 4.19.12.17 Incorporated into IRM 4.19.12.7 Old IRM 4.19.18 Incorporated valid process into 4.19.12.9 Old Exhibit 4.19.12-1 and Removed obsolete exhibits of 4.19.12-2 CSP reports and error list.
The IRM was revised to review and clarify language throughout. All references and websites were also updated.
This IRM supersedes IRM 4.19.12 dates 12/02/2011.
This IRM is intended for the use of the SB/SE Campus Examination
Table of Contents
and Scheduling
page (

) Purpose: This section provides information to campus and area office personnel who use the Centralized Filing & Scheduling (CF&S) system. It is structured to follow the process of supporting the Area Office personnel with returns received in the campus for Planning and Special Programs (PSP) siﬁcation. Returns ordered and classiﬁed through the Compliance Data Environment (CDE) system are covered in IRM
, Compliance Data ronment (CDE), IRM
, Workload Identiﬁcation and Survey Procedures, and IRM
, Case Building, Classiﬁcation, Storage and Delivery (
) Audience: These guidelines and procedures apply to SB/SE exam who support Area Office classiﬁcation of returns. (
) Policy Owner: The Small Business/Self-Employed Division (SB/SE) Director Examination Campus and Field Policy. (
) Program Owner: Program Manager Campus Examination and Field Support (
) Primary Stakeholders: Small Business/Self-Employed Division (SB/SE) (
) Program Goals: The program goals are to ensure support of Area Office tiﬁcation and classiﬁcation of tax returns for examination to promote compliance. (

) After selection for examination in the centralized classiﬁcation function, were moved to the Centralized Files and Scheduling Unit (CFSU). Files and Scheduling (CF&S) system was a process to build a database and schedule work using computerized lists and reports. Discriminant Function (DIF) returns were ordered, classiﬁed, perfected, and stored through the campus CFSU. The returns were ﬁled on the shelves in ascending AIMS Number sequence. The Area offices no longer order and classify DIF returns through the campus CFSU. The Centralized Scheduling Data Base (CSDB) and the generated Centralized Files and Scheduling Project (CSP) reports no longer used at the campus. In January
the last Area office to ordering and classifying DIF returns through the Compliance Data ment (CDE) system. (

) Automatic returns are still sent to the campus CFSU. When an original return is ﬁled and processed through Submission Processing (SP) and if it meets certain conditions, an audit code is placed on the return. See IRM Audit Codes and IRM
, Audit Codes. An AIMS base is automatically opened and the return is shipped to the campus CFSU for Area office cation. (

Director, Examination Field and Campus Policy is responsible for leading the development and delivery of policy and guidance that impacts SB/SE taxpayers and SB/SE Campus and Field examination processes.

Exam and Field Support, which is under the Director, Examination - and Campus Policy, is the group responsible for providing Servicewide guidance on compliance processes that relate to campus examination operations and support Field Exam and Specialty programs.
The following table lists commonly used acronyms and their deﬁnitions used throughout this IRM.

Acronym Deﬁnition AAC AIMS Assignee Code A-CIS AIMS Centralized Information System AIMS Audit Information Management System AM Account Management AMAXU A correction command code that is used to change or input various ﬁelds to a speciﬁed record on AIMS. Refer to IRM 2.8.6.2, Command Code AMAXU. AMDISA Displays up to six screens of in- formation about the taxpayer’s account for a speciﬁc tax period. Refer to IRM 2.8.3-7, Command Code AMDISA. AMS Account Management System AMSOC Used to enter short closing when a return is established on AIMS. Refer to IRM 2.8.5.2, Account Short Closing Command Code AMSOC. BMF Business Master File

Acronym Deﬁnition BMFOLT This command code is provided to furnish access to the Business Master File. Refer to IRM 2.3.59- 17, Command Code BMFOL Tax Module Display Tax. CDE Compliance Data Environment CF&S Centralized Files and Scheduling CFSU Centralized Files Scheduling Unit CSDB Centralized Scheduling Database DIF Discriminant Function DLN Document Locator Number EGC Examination Group Code EIN Employer Identiﬁcation Number ESTAB This command code is used to enter requests for original documents, copies, information, etc. Refer to IRM 2.3.62, Command Code ESTAB. EUP Employee User Portal GII Generalized IDRS Interface HQ Headquarters IDRS Integrated Data Retrieval System IMFOLT Provides read-only access to the Individual Master File. Refer to IRM 2.3.51, Command Code IMFOL. IRMF Information Return Master File IRSS Information Return Selection System IVL Individual Validation Listing (of accounts on AIMS) MeF Modernized E-File MFT Master File Tax Mod-E Modernized E-File , same as MeF PBC Preliminary Business Code POD Post of Duty PSP Planning and Special Programs

Acronym Deﬁnition SBC Secondary Business Code SB/SE Small Business Self-Employed SP Submission Processing SSIVL Statistical Sample Inventory Vali- dation Listing SSN Social Security Number TC Transaction Code TIN Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number TPI Total Positive Income TRDBV Retrieves a summary of the available tax information on Tax Return Data Base (TRDB). Refer to IRM 2.3.73.1, Command Code (CC) TRDBV.

, AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions (
) Before the Area Offices began using CDE for ordering and classifying DIF returns, the PSP Territory Manager submitted return orders to the campuses accordance with IRM
, Guidelines for Ordering Returns. The orders were submitted to Martinsburg Computing Center (MCC) each cycle for pro- cessing. Returns were received approximately six to eight weeks later with Form
, Examination Return Charge-out Sheet, labels, and Individual Return Masterﬁle (IRMF) transcripts and forwarded to Field Examination for classiﬁers to screen. (

) For planning purposes, it was imperative that the CF&S Team Manager be provided with the volume of returns ordered each cycle and approximate classiﬁcation began. This information allowed the manager to effectively allocate resources in order for newly-classiﬁed returns to be processed the system in a timely fashion because: a. of returns ordered, approximately
% to

% were missing (charged to SOI, Adjustments, etc. in the campus). b. missing returns percentages varied signiﬁcantly among campuses or at different times during the classiﬁcation year. c. of returns delivered for screening, only a percentage were selected for examination.
Before the Area Offices began using CDE for ordering and classifying DIF returns, the PSP Territory Manager submitted return orders to the campuses in accordance with IRM
, Guidelines for Ordering Returns. The orders were submitted to Martinsburg Computing Center (MCC) each cycle for pro- cessing. Returns were received approximately six to eight weeks later with Form
, Examination Return Charge-out Sheet, labels, and Individual Return Masterﬁle (IRMF) transcripts and forwarded to Field Examination for classiﬁers to screen.

Files and Scheduling
) Classiﬁers screening returns completed the appropriate classiﬁcation form based on the return type for each selected return. IRM
, Background, provides instructions for the completion of the checksheet by classiﬁer. After screening, returns were forwarded to CFSU for processing. (
) Currently the only returns CF&S receive are audit coded returns that are matically opened on AIMs. These returns are classiﬁed by the area offices. (
) The AIMS Serial Number is a vital part of CF&S. The AIMS Serial Number
-digit number. The ﬁrst
digits represent the Area Office Primary Code (PBC), the next
digits indicate weekly opening cycle, and the remaining
digits are sequentially assigned when the return is established AIMS. (
) If an AIMS Serial Number is not on the AIMS Data Base, CFSU should: a. Use AMAXU to place serial numbers on return. b. Verify new AIMS Serial Number via AMDISA. (
) If duplicate AIMS Serial Numbers are present (for example, when a return is transferred from one area office to another), a new AIMS Serial Number be assigned using IDRS Command Code AMAXU. (

) Manual Orders are received in CFSU from the area PSP via e-mail, cases be pulled from various POD’s and activity codes. The order may be requested by either receipt of an e-mail or an Excel spreadsheet containing IVL information. The PSP will request the status, organization code, business code, post of duty, activity code (TPI class), and number of cases needed. (
) Paper Returns- When an original return is ﬁled and processed through mission Processing (SP), an audit code is placed on the return if it meets certain conditions. See IRM
, Audit Codes, and IRM

, Audit Codes. Depending on the audit code, an AIMS base is automatically opened and the return is shipped to the campus CFSU. The CFSU routes returns out as directed by the Area office for PSP classiﬁcation. An overview the process is as follows: a. Research IDRS to conﬁrm the return aligns with the Area office the campus CFSU services. b. Update the EGC to

Based on the with the Area office, the returns are either shipped out monthly or held until requested by the Area office. d. The campus CFSU will receive an e-mail and/or a Excel spreadsheet from PSP with the return classiﬁcation results. An overview of the process is as follows.
follows. a. Research IDRS to conﬁrm the return aligns with the Area office the campus CFSU services. b. Verify AIMS shows EGC

c. File and hold the charge out either in a ﬂat or shelving in AIMS Serial order. d. The PSP will e-mail CFSU an Excel spreadsheet with the classiﬁcation results and the classiﬁcation sheet to be associated with the case. The spreadsheet indicates what EGC each classiﬁed case should be to. It can also contain those they want surveyed (Accepted as ﬁled). e. The classiﬁcation sheet is printed and associated with the charge out a case folder is built. f. The case is updated on AIMS and suspended on the shelf until by the Field group. g. When return orders are received, it is pulled from the suspense ﬁle and using cc AMSTU the AIMS SBC, EGC, and status is updated. h. Returns are shipped out with a Form

, Document Transmittal. Note: Depending on the agreement between the PSP and the servicing CFSU, there may only be an e-mail without attachments instructing the campus to update all cases into one Field group EGC . (
) The Area Office PSP has sole authority to survey returns. CFSU managers must have written authorization from the Area Office PSP Territory Manager before surveying returns. (

) Although surveys are normally done on an Area Office-by-Area Office basis using the tax year as the main criterion, surveys may be requested for a speciﬁc activity code, speciﬁc POD, speciﬁc year, or a combination thereof. A survey may be done any time the PSP Territory Manager determines the returns are not needed. When possible, Area Offices should request surveys quarterly (or more often, if desired), to avoid the need for large survey requests at the end of the year. (
) The PSP sends an e-mail listing of cases to be surveyed to the CFSU. The following survey actions will be preformed by CFSU for classiﬁed paper in status
EGCs,
, and

When possible, Area Offices should request quarterly (or more often, if desired), to avoid the need for large survey requests at the end of the year. ) When receiving amended returns due to open AIMS controls in status

lower, the amended return will be sent back to the originator with instructions to follow Accounts Management (AM) processing requirements. If the return has already been processed and is sent for association with an open case in status
or

, the case should be immediately pulled for review by the local Campus Classiﬁcation Unit to determine if the case and amended return should be sent to the ﬁeld. No amended return should be associated with a case ready to be closed survey. (

) Updating and foldering selected ﬁeld returns includes entering appropriate EGC code and perfecting appropriate forms. Selected ﬁeld returns may be or BMF. IMF returns may be selected for Field rather than Office if warrants. (

, Non-DIF Corporate Classiﬁcation Checksheet and Form
, Revenue Agent - Classiﬁcation Checksheet. (

) Folder returns as follows: a. Place a POD label on the top right corner of a plain folder. b. Place a status label on the selected classiﬁcation form in the name address area. c. Sort in AIMS order by grade. (

CSFU will e-mail the AM headquarters claim analyst with the account information identify- ing the campus where the claim is located. The AM analyst coordinates the -A freeze resolution between campuses and notiﬁes CFSU when it is resolved.

There are times when an account cannot be surveyed because of a -A freeze on the module. The -A freeze is set when a duplicate return (TC 976), subse- quent return (TC 977) or a TC 971 with action code (AC) 010 or AC 012-015 (amended return), post to an account. Amended returns in status 08 or lower will be in Accounts Management (AM) or Submission Processing (SP) for pro- cessing. See IRM 21.5.3-1, Claim Processing with Exam Involvement. CFSU cannot survey the return until the -A freeze is resolved by AM or SP. CSFU e-mail the AM headquarters claim analyst with the account information ing the campus where the claim is located. The AM analyst coordinates the -A freeze resolution between campuses and notiﬁes CFSU when it is resolved.
When receiving amended returns due to open AIMS controls in status

and lower, the amended return will be sent back to the originator with instructions to follow Accounts Management (AM) processing requirements. If the amended return has already been processed and is sent for association with an open case in status
or

, the case should be immediately pulled for review by the local Campus Classiﬁcation Unit to determine if the case and amended return should be sent to the ﬁeld. No amended return should be associated with a case ready to be closed survey.

) Cases are then placed in a designated holding area unless PSP provides different direction. (

) Classiﬁers may accept returns as ﬁled. When the classiﬁcation details were held at the campus, they stamped the return “Accepted as Filed” with the Field siﬁer’s number and date. The PSP now provides an e-mail or Excel spreadsheet containing return closing guidance. Accepted cases will be using disposal code

and Scheduling
page (
) In order to send a case to PSP, continue to look for the case. If you have a case controlled that is in
but you cannot locate, research it before conducting any further work on the case. (
) If closing the case, take the following steps: a. Pull an AMDISA for the SSN/EIN for the correct Tax Year. b. Pull IDRS for the same year. c. If AMDISA shows status
, print a TRDBV, all copies. d. Associate the AMDISA to the TRDBV and prepare for closing. Be sure to include proper blocking series on the AIMS print when closing. (
) Periodically, a list of all returns on which the statute of limitations will expire in

days or less or has expired is sent to the organization charged with the returns. To work the table correctly, the following actions are taken: a. Check AMDISA for current status and organization. b. If on database (status and EGC’s
or EGCs according to campus), check in ﬁles for return. c. If not in ﬁles, request IMFOLT/BMFOLT to obtain the
DLN or reﬁled DLN. d. ESTAB for return under the
DLN or reﬁle DLN. e. When the return is received, close case with a
disposal code. f. If the return is not received after ESTAB has been sent to Files and only a charge-out is received, close with disposal code
g. Cases on the Table
showing in status
EGC
or
, should be pulled and worked the same.
Check AMDISA for current status and organization. If on database (status and EGC’s
